span.title: Logical model for prescribed/dispensed medication. The model is shared by statements, requests, dispensations, and administrations. Each of those may have different restrictions in a FHIR profile. The model is suitable for generic/virtual medications as well as branded/real products. The model aims to have basic alignment with ISO IDMP but it does not cover the full complexity needed for medication registries.

span.title: dateTime Type: A date, date-time or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month). If hours and minutes are specified, a UTC offset SHALL be populated. The format is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth, date and dateTime. Seconds must be provided due to schema type constraints but may be zero-filled and may be ignored. Dates SHALL be valid dates.

span.title: Period Type: A time period defined by a start and end date and optionally time.

description.value: The model covers details about a requested service or services. One order may include several requests.

short.value: Service request model

definition.value: The model covers details about a requested service or services. One order may include several requests.

short.value: Basic metadata for this information

definition.value: Basic metadata for this information

short.value: Patient/subject information

definition.value: Patient/subject information

short.value: Business identifier for the object, unique within its system. Supporting disambiguation between different contexts (systems/countries).

definition.value: Business identifier for the object, unique within its system. Supporting disambiguation between different contexts (systems/countries).

short.value: Author(s) responsible for the provided information.

definition.value: Author(s) responsible for the provided information. The exact role of the responsible author varies across use cases and is specific to individual models.

short.value: Date and optionally time of authoring/issuing

definition.value: Date and optionally time of authoring/issuing

short.value: Status of the resource or document

definition.value: Status of the resource or document

short.value: Source of information (e.g. patient, patient's proxy). Used in case the patient has authored the information or the author has submitted patient-stated information.

definition.value: Source of information (e.g. patient, patient's proxy). Used in case the patient has authored the information or the author has submitted patient-stated information.

short.value: Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.

definition.value: Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.

short.value: Textual description of the requested service

definition.value: Textual description of the requested service

short.value: A code and name that identifies a particular service (i.e., procedure, diagnostic investigation, or panel of investigations) that have been requested.

definition.value: A code and name that identifies a particular service (i.e., procedure, diagnostic investigation, or panel of investigations) that have been requested.

short.value: Amount of requested services of the same type

definition.value: Amount of requested services of the same type

short.value: Anatomic location and laterality where the procedure should be performed. This is the target site.

definition.value: Anatomic location and laterality where the procedure should be performed. This is the target site.

short.value: A reference to reason why this service is being requested.

definition.value: A reference to reason why this service is being requested.

short.value: Indicates how quickly the request should be addressed with respect to other requests.

definition.value: Indicates how quickly the request should be addressed with respect to other requests.

short.value: A reference to the health conditions and other clinical information relevant for the results interpretation, e.g. fasting status, sex for clinical use, etc.

definition.value: A reference to the health conditions and other clinical information relevant for the results interpretation, e.g. fasting status, sex for clinical use, etc.
Specimens to be used by the laboratory procedure
An encounter that provides additional information about the healthcare context in which this request is made.
